analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma paccanīya anuloma duka duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The reverse order of the law of conditionality, the text of the Paṭṭhāna in pairs of opposites

The pair on the unconditioned, the pair on associated with cause🔽With the unconditioned and not associated with cause as condition, the conditioned and associated with cause arises.🔽With the unconditioned and not associated with cause as condition, the conditioned and associated with cause arises.

original: Nasaraṇaṁ nahetusampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca araṇo hetusampayutto dhammo uppajjati🔽hetupaccayā. Naaraṇaṁ nahetusampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saraṇo hetusampayutto dhammo
analyzed: na saraṇam na hetu sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca araṇaḥ hetu sampayuttaḥ dhammo uppajjati  hetu paccayā na araṇam na hetu sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca saraṇaḥ hetu sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ
translated: With the unconditioned and not associated with cause as condition, the conditioned and associated with cause arises.

original: uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā dve …pe… purejāte āsevane ekaṁ …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate dve.🔽Nasaraṇaṁ nahetuvippayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca araṇo hetuvippayutto dhammo uppajjati
